abstract: Dynegy, an energy company, said Friday that it has agreed to sell itself to the Blackstone Group for $4.7 billion, including debt, in one of the largest leveraged buyouts of the year.
snippet: Dynegy, an energy company, said Friday that it has agreed to sell itself to the Blackstone Group for $4.7 billion, including debt, in one of the largest leveraged buyouts of the year.
lead_paragraph: 12:18 p.m. | Updated 8:36 a.m. | Updated Dynegy, an energy company, said Friday that it has agreed to sell itself to the Blackstone Group for $4.7 billion, including debt, in one of the largest leveraged buyouts of the year.

headline.main: Blackstone to Buy Dynegy for $4.7 Billion
